curam.util.ctm.bom

Interface RevertChangeSetConstructionHandlerBOM

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BusinessObjectModule

    public interface RevertChangeSetConstructionHandlerBOM
extends BusinessObjectModule

    Business object types that require to customize the process of constructing the revert change set can provide customized implementation of this BOM to achieve the desired functionality. Because it is an optional BOM, it is not mandatory for every business object type to provide a customized implementation.

    Before the introduction of this interface, the construction of revert change set is entirely controlled by the infrastructure. For a given business object identifier, the decision to identify the right business object(s) to be added to the revert change set along with the instruction type (which could be Add or Delete) will be made by the infrastructure by comparing the content from the base change set and the relevant content from the database. Using this interface, for a given business object identifier, a business object module implementation can supply additional unrelated business objects to be added to the revert change set.

    As an example, consider a change set containing a new business object which is of type LocationStructure. 

     LS Change Set
 [
  LocationStructure-X
 ]
    Also, assume that in the database, there is an active LocationStructure business object instance, lets' say LocationStructure-A. After applying the change set, when the infrastructure creates a revert change set for this base change set, it will construct a revert change set containing Delete instruction for the newly added LocationStructure. 
     Revert Change Set of (LS Change Set)
 [
  LocationStructure-X/Delete
 ]
    Now, applying the revert change set should ideally activate the business object LocationStructure-A (as this business object was previously active) and in-activate the LocationStrucure-X (as this got newly added through the change set). But this cannot happen and this will be possible only if the revert change set contains the following instructions and hence customization is necessary. 
     Revert Change Set of (LS Change Set)
 [
  LocationStructure-X/Delete
  LocationStructure-A/Add
 ]

    It should be noted that, in the above example, the revert change set containing the instruction LocationStructure-X/Delete will be automatically computed and will be added to the revert change set by the infrastructure. The BOM implementation has to only identify the unrelated business object(s) identifier, which is LocationStructure-A (in the above case) and return them to the infrastructure. Also, there is no need for the implementation to specify the instruction type of the unrelated business object(s), because the infrastructure knows how to identify the instruction type for a given business object identifier.

      java.util.Set<BusinessObjectIdentifier> constructBusinessObjectIdentifiers(BusinessObjectIdentifier businessObjectIdentifier, org.w3c.dom.Document businessObjectDocument)
      For a given business object, infrastructure will call the constructBusinessObjectIdentifiers method while constructing the revert change set contents.

      • Methods inherited from interface curam.util.ctm.bom.BusinessObjectModule

        getName, getOffset, getType

    • Method Detail

      • constructBusinessObjectIdentifiers

        java.util.Set<BusinessObjectIdentifier> constructBusinessObjectIdentifiers(BusinessObjectIdentifier businessObjectIdentifier,
                                                                           org.w3c.dom.Document businessObjectDocument)
                                                                    throws AppException,
                                                                           InformationalException

        For a given business object, infrastructure will call the constructBusinessObjectIdentifiers method while constructing the revert change set contents.

        A typical BOM implementation needs to identify the unrelated business object identifier(s) for the incoming business object identifier and return them to the infrastructure for further processing. The applicable action type (which is Add or Delete) for the returned unrelated business objects will be automatically computed by the infrastructure.

        An out-of-the-box 'no-op' implementation will be provided for Business Object Types that does not require this functionality.

        Parameters:
        businessObjectIdentifier - Contains the identifier which is used to uniquely identify a business object.
        businessObjectDocument - Represents the equivalent XML document fragment for the incoming business object.
        Returns:
        Returns the unrelated business object identifiers for the given business object identifier.
        Throws:
        AppException - Generic exception signature.
        InformationalException - Generic exception signature.
